qas.question: How can a wrestler willingly submit?
What is the move called where all limbs are incapicitated?
What can a wrestler do to show a willing submission?

context: A wrestler may voluntarily submit by <a0_0>verbally informing the referee<a0_0/> (usually used in moves such as the <a1_0>Mexican Surfboard<a1_0/>, where all four limbs are incapacitated, making tapping impossible). Also, since Ken Shamrock (a legitimate UFC competitor in its early days) popularized it in 1997, a wrestler can indicate a voluntary submission by "<a2_0>tapping out<a2_0/>", that is, tapping a free hand against the mat or against an opponent. Occasionally, a wrestler will reach for a rope (see rope breaks below), only to put their hand back on the mat so they can crawl towards the rope some more; this is not a submission, and the referee decides what their intent is.
